title: Find the limits
text: In order to set up the definite integrals of the $$2$$ functions, we have to find the limits where they intersect by setting them equal to each other and solve for $$x$$.

title: Find the limits
text: $$x^3=x^2+x$$ then $$x=0$$, $$x=\frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{2}$$ and $$x=\frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{2}$$. So we obtain $$x=\frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{2}$$ as a lower limit and $$x=0$$ as an upper limit for the region on the left side of the y-axis. The second limit for the region on the right side of the y-axis has a lower limit as $$x=0$$ and an upper limit as $$x=\frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{2}$$

The second limit for the region on the right side of the y-axis has a lower limit as  x, is equal to 0  and an upper limit as  x, is equal to fraction, 1 plus the square root of 5 over 2,

title: Define the upper graph
text: The area of A is given by int{abs(f(x)-g(x)),a,b,x}, as f(x) is an upper graph and g(x) is the lower one.

title: Evaluate
speech: fraction, 13 minus, 5 the square root of 5 over 24,  plus fraction, 13 plus, 5 the square root of 5 over 24,  is equal to 13 over 12
